revised_title: Wave-length Determinations and General Results of the Solar Eclipse of January 22, 1898
tldr: The author analyzes spectra photographed during the solar eclipse of January 22, 1898, and discusses the wave-length determinations and general results obtained. The study reveals the presence of various elements in the solar spectrum, including hydrogen, helium, and calcium, and provides insights into the structure and composition of the solar chromosphere.
